intro: Dioscorea quinata, commonly known as Chinese yam, is a perennial vine native to Asia. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers and develops yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. Its tubers are widely used in traditional medicine and as a food source in various cultures. The botanical features of D. quinata make it an important species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
